resources.string: Welcome to app which demonstrates saving and restoring state.
Select one of the cases in drawer menu and see how the activities should keep the content\'s state.

The framework handles saving the simple state of the Views automatically. The only thing which has to be done to trigger this behavior is to add the ids to the Views. We\'ll use a ScrollView as an example. Note that the contents of the screen are the same before and after the rotation. They don\'t change also when the Activity is brought back from the background.
This behavior is triggered automatically by the framework. The only task for the developer is to add the `id` to the `Views` which state should be saved.
